description: Curated library of interesting biomorph specimens across all modes and symmetry types
notes: Generated by exploring morphospace programmatically (scoring 1000s of random specimens) and hand-tuning classic forms. Each specimen includes breeder URL for easy viewing.

classics.description: Hand-tuned specimens resembling recognizable biological forms

specimens.name: Fern
specimens.notes: The original Dawkins biomorph — a recursive fern. Symmetric, elegant, tree-like.

specimens.name: Insect
specimens.notes: Six-legged body with antennae. One of the forms Dawkins described discovering.

specimens.name: Spider
specimens.notes: Wide-legged arachnid form. Perfectly symmetric with outstretched appendages.

specimens.name: Bat
specimens.notes: Winged form with spread canopy. Balanced and complex.

specimens.name: Willow
specimens.notes: Tall, drooping form like a weeping willow. Mostly vertical vectors.

specimens.name: Lobster
specimens.notes: Crustacean-like form with claws and segmented body appearance.

specimens.name: Coral
specimens.notes: Dense branching form resembling coral or a bush. Wide and complex.

specimens.name: Candelabra
specimens.notes: Symmetric branching candelabra shape with upward-reaching arms.

symmetry_showcase.description: Same base genes shown with different symmetry types

specimens.name: Snowflake
specimens.notes: Radially symmetric like a snowflake or mandala. Striking geometric pattern.

specimens.name: Butterfly
specimens.notes: Vertically mirrored — looks like a butterfly with wings spread.

specimens.name: Compass Rose
specimens.notes: The classic fern genes in four-way symmetry. Creates a compass/star shape.

specimens.name: Jellyfish
specimens.notes: Up-down mirrored candelabra creates a jellyfish/medusa form.

specimens.name: Celtic Knot
specimens.notes: Four-way radial creates an interlocking Celtic knot pattern.

specimens.name: Moth
specimens.notes: Bat genes with up-down symmetry — becomes a moth with mirrored wings.

mode1_best.description: Top-scoring Mode 1 specimens from random exploration (200 samples)

specimens.name: Antler
specimens.notes: Branching antler form. High symmetry and balance.

specimens.name: Crown
specimens.notes: Wide crown shape with dense branching at tips.

specimens.name: Chandelier
specimens.notes: Hanging ornamental form with delicate branches.

specimens.name: Peacock
specimens.notes: Spread fan form with recursive detail at edges.

specimens.name: Cypress
specimens.notes: Tall narrow tree form. Vertical emphasis with slight branching.

segmented.description: Mode 3 specimens with varying segment counts — body plans emerge

specimens.name: Centipede
specimens.notes: 5 segments, medium spacing. Elongated arthropod form.

specimens.name: Scorpion
specimens.notes: 3 segments with wide spacing. Tail-like extension from segmentation.

specimens.name: Caterpillar
specimens.notes: 4 segments, close spacing. Rounded repeated body sections.

specimens.name: Dragonfly
specimens.notes: 2 segments with wide spacing. Wing-like extensions from each segment.

specimens.name: Sea Horse
specimens.notes: 3 segments with curved, flowing body form.

full_dawkins.description: Mode 4-5 specimens with gradient tapering — the most complex forms

specimens.name: Sequoia
specimens.notes: Gradient taper (2,2) creates a massive tree form that narrows at top.

specimens.name: Orchid
specimens.notes: Opposing gradients (-3,3) create delicate, petal-like forms.

specimens.name: Antenna Array
specimens.notes: Gradient creates a technological/antenna-like form.

specimens.name: Coral Reef
specimens.notes: Dense branching with gradient taper. Organic reef-like.

specimens.name: Totem
specimens.notes: 5 segments with uniform gradient. Stacked, totem-pole-like structure.

specimens.name: Snowflake Crystal
specimens.notes: Snowflake base in Full Dawkins mode with gradient. Crystalline.

bizarre.description: Asymmetric, alien forms — high complexity, low symmetry

specimens.name: Signal Tower
specimens.notes: Tall asymmetric form resembling a communications tower.

specimens.name: Flying Machine
specimens.notes: Wide-armed mechanical form. Da Vinci-esque.

specimens.name: Fractal Vine
specimens.notes: Flowing vine-like tendrils with fractal branching at tips.

specimens.name: Neuron
specimens.notes: Branching dendrite-like form with complex endpoints.

specimens.name: Alien Glyph
specimens.notes: Abstract symbol-like form. Four-way symmetry creates alien writing.
